oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Capt. Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his family
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Capt. A. D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his family. He writes of hearing reports of skirmishes near Alexandria and of the enemy being at Rome, Carthage, and Lebanon and that Gen. Reynolds division was 10,000 strong there. He; writes that they are "still stationed at our old Camping ground where the regiment has been station since last Christmas. Not a wave of excitement breaks the monotony of camp life." He concludes by writing of Col. Goodner's resignation and the weather.
